|Then|the user can select as X axis the decorators of the item of the hierarchy selected (FAMILY, {*}SUBFAMILY{*}, ATTRIBUTE) only if they exists|

As default, Attribute, if there is not attribute other.

Becareful there more decorators types

|When|selects an item of the hierarchy that is a SECTION, PRODUCT_TYPE or BRAND and access to the accumulated purchase graph view|
|Then|the user can see only one axis that are the children of the item of the hierarchy selected|

Example, if the user selects MAN (as section), the X axix possibility will be only BUYER and the items, the BUYERs of the section MAN

|Given|a sitdeo user|

content:
*AS*Â a SitDep user

*I WANT* to see the expected entries graph in informational mode

*TO* know which is the lack of purchase to arrive to my target of the month

Â 

*---*

*Context:*

Thin Black (Informational) --> Formalized entries (Pending+Entered) A-1

Bold Black (Informational) --> Formalized entries (Pending+Entered) A

Blue (Informational) --> Pre-ordered (Informational will give us the pre-ordered under the department criteria)

Â 

Red --> We will get the target of entries from the MFP. We will show to the user the DIFF target-entries. So that the user have an idea of the need.

We need to add a selector to allow the user to consider in the sustraction the pre-ordered or not.

The red will give to the user an idea of in real time how many purchase is still pending to be done so that the target is committed.

*Note: We can't say that the red part is the need, because the "need" as defined KPI is the one showed in Controller's tool, and this one has particular rules to be calculated.*Â

content:
*AS* a SitDep user

*I WANT* to see main KPIs of Markup from informational services in all casesÂ 

*TO* analyse the markup of my department

--------------------------------------------------------------

The desired behaviour for Markup main KPIs is:
 * the selected item is an intermediate hierarchy --> request me | request my children
 * the selected item is the last one in the hierarchy (if children is BUYER_CODE and user has permissions to show parent category) -->
 ** if condition is true --> request my father | request me and my brothers
 ** else --> request me | don't request children

The expected situation is that if the father of the item selected is not in the permissions of the user, the item should be shown as a father without children.Â 

Besides for error management it is needed:
 - Request Parent
 - Request Children
Â 
00 --> Error of section
01 --> Error in KPI of the father --> ! | KPI1 KPI2...
10 --> Error in KPIs childrem --> KPI | ! ! ! !... (as many errors as items in hierarchy)
11 --> OK
Â 
Cases for infor - pur hierarchy
Â 
01 --> do not show this KPI --> "Make a reguster in Grafana --> urn find in pur. hiearchy not in infor."Â 
10 --> do not show this KPI --> "Make a register in Grafana --> urn find in infor not in pur. hierarchy"
11 --> OK we have both matching
Â 
Cases for valuesÂ 
 - Null "-"
 - 0 --> 0
 - value --> value
 - Nan "-"

Â 

--------------------------------------------------------------

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Main KPIs Markup|

-
|Scenario|The user selects an intermediate item of the hierarchy. Permissions to see the father|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup screen and selects an intermediate item of the hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user sees the main KPIs: selected item \| their children|
|Then|The user sees the arrow to navigate to the father|

-
|Scenario|The user selects an intermediate item of the hierarchy. *No* permissions to see the father|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup screen and selects an intermediate item of the hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user sees the main KPIs: selected item \| their children|
|Then|The user does not see the arrow to navigate to the father|

-
|Scenario|The user selects the last item of the hierarchy. Permissions to see the father. Permissions to see the father of the father|
|Given|a sitDep user|
|When|access to Markup screen and selects the last item of the hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user sees the main KPIs: father \| selected item + same level|
|Then|The user sees the arrow to navigate to the father of the father of the selected item|

-
|Scenario|The user selects the last item of the hierarchy. Permissions to see the father. *No* Permissions to see the father of the father|
|Given|a sitDep user|
|When|access to Markup screen and selects the last item of the hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user sees the main KPIs: father \| selected item + same level|
|Then|The user does not see the arrow to navigate to the next level|

-
|Scenario|The user selects the last item of the hierarchy. *No* Permissions to see the father. *No* Permissions to see the father of the father|
|Given|a sitDep user|
|When|access to Markup screen and selects the last item of the hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user sees the main KPIs: selected item|
|Then|The user does not see the arrow to navigate to the next level|

-
Error management in informational Requests
Â 
|Scenario|Error in father and in children|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and the request to purchase main KPIs
-Request to father fails
-Request to children fails|
|Then|The user sees a global error in the section of main KPIs|

-
|Scenario|Error in father and NO error children|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and the request to purchase main KPIs
-Request to father fails
-Request to children works|
|Then|The user sees the father KPI with error symbol|
|Then|The user sees the children KPIs correctly|

-
|Scenario|NO error in father and error children|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and the request to purchase main KPIs
-Request to father works
-Request to children fails|
|Then|The user sees the father KPI correctly|
|Then|The user sees the children KPIs with error symbol|

--------------

Inconsistency between hierarchy and informational response
|Scenario|Item in hierarchy not found in informationals|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and the request to purchase main KPIs
-An item present in the hierarchy that is not present in informational response|
|Then|The user does not see the KPI in the main KPIs|
|Then|The BFF will register a specific event in logs "Item XXX found in hierarchy and not returning data from informational services" (or similar)|

-

|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and the request to purchase main KPIs
-An item present in the informational response but not present in hierarchyÂ |
|Then|The user does not see the KPI in the main KPIs|
|Then|The BFF will register a specific event in logs "Item XXX found in informational and not recognised in purchase hierarchy" (or similar)|

-
|Scenario|Selected item of the hierarchy does not return data in informationals|
|Given|a sitdep user|
|When|access to Markup view and select an item of the hierarchy that does not return any data from informationals|
|Then|The user sees the KPI of the selected item as "-"|

Accumulated purchase to date of the equivalent campaign/Accumulated purchase at the end of the equivalent campaig*100

Â 

Currently, the code is looking for the indicator in the MFP asÂ purchase-commitment-to-date-a1

We need:

*To recover both from informational: (1) Accumulated purchase to date of the equivalent campaign and (2) Accumulated purchase at the end of the equivalent campaig in two different request

*Calculate the final indicator using the formula:

Accumulated purchase to date of the equivalent campaign/Accumulated purchase at the end of the equivalent campaig*100

------------------------------------

content:
*AS* a User

*I WANT* selected graph filter saved per selected category

*TO*Â improve usability when navigating between categories

Â 

Currently when user selects accumulated purchase graph filter and picks a value then it is persisted to local/session storage. When user leaves page and comes back, the persisted value is shown.

When user navigates to another department, then same filter value is shown. This value should be scoped only for one department, not for all of them. We should use default value provided by backend if user has not selected a value for category.

Â 

We should use provided IOP context from Shell (that wrap local storage) to store values such as user filters for graphs. Instead of using local storage or session storage directly.
This will unify approaches used in all purposes and avoid key collision problems that can happen between our purposes and with other apps under Shell.
Example how to do this: [https://iop-buyers-shell.docs.inditex.dev/shlpbuyers/stable/common-context/remote.html]
Important part is to mark current purpose MFE as "remote" and use storage under that store.

â€“
|Scenario 1|The user selects for BUYER1 the filter Attribute|
|Given|A sitdep user|
|When|Opens the graph of accumulated purchase using Attribute as x axis for the BUYER 1, goes to another buyer and comes back to purchase view|
|Then|Sees the accumulated purchase graph with the last selection for this specific BUYER 1|

-
|Scenario 2|The user selects for BUYER1 the expected entries graph|
|Given|A sitdep user|
|When|Opens the graph of expected entries and change the item of the hierarchy selected|
|Then|Sees the expected entries graph for the other item selected if it is available|

-

Â 

Acceptance:Â 
 * When the user refresh or change the item of the hierarchy in the same BUYER they should see exactly what they had selected previously
 * When the user changes from one BUYER to another, the user will see exactly what the last selection he had for this BUYER.Â

content:
Due do different level of privileges our users have, they can access more categories of hierarchy than our backend supports.

Backend currently responds with 500 and we can see in logs
!image-2024-03-07-13-02-51-310.png|width=1153,height=385!

The problem comes from creating the request we are sending to Informational service. They have defined enums that do not support higher hierarchy values such as BRAND, PRODUCT_TYPE, SECTION.

In such case we should not fail with 500, but return to user that no data was available.Â 

This way higher hierarchies will load, but won't show any data until Informational side updates their API.
h4. Acceptance criteria

Requesting data from informational services with categories BRAND, PRODUCT_TYPE, SECTION (are there more?) should not cause backend to return 500. We should return 200 with no data instead.

Â

content:
*AS*Â sitdep user

*I WANT* to be able to navigate between levels of the hierarchy using the main KPIs of sales

*TO* easily analyse the situation of my departement at sales level
 * brand;
 * product-type;
 * section;
 * buyer;
 * buyer-group;
 * buyer-subgroup;
 * buyer-code

_____________________

Context: In IOP you want to remove the BUYER_CODE (current leaf node of the purchasing hierarchy). But currently it cannot be removed because it is the only mandatory field for article in Legacy.

Â 

Technical solutions:

FRONT--> Feature Flag true/false to remove leaf node.

BFF --> Levels variable setup to remove from hierarchy

Â 

USE CASE: Main KPIs of all functionalities of the SITDEP purpose Navigation with KPI selection

Â 
 * In the main KPIs in WEB we want that when filtering or navigating through the main KPIs we want to load the entire screen.
 * Contract stays as it is: we change a FT on the front. The data is given as in POD3.
 ** 2 cases:
 *** Parent - children --> Intermediate item selection --> The one selected as parent and the children are returned.
 *** Parents - leaf --> Leaf item selection --> The parent of the selected, the selected and the siblings are returned.
 ** iOS:
 *** Knows the selected and paints it based on whether it is parent or child, chooses screen.
Â 

USE CASE: Main KPIs. Navigation up with the arrow
 * Send a previus with the previous level.

_______________________

|Then|in WEB, the main KPIs of sales are:Â  the selected item as the father the childs at right part|

 * Sum of tonage of better and conventional of a given variant group
 * Sum of tonage of better and conventional of all variant groups

*AS*Â department managerÂ 

*I WANT* to see graphically the evolution of actual sales for a given period (two past months, the current month and 4 future months) by month.Â 

*TO* analyze the evolution of sales for a given period, analyzed on a monthly basis, compared to sales for the same period in an equivalent month.

Â 

Fiscal year: from February to JanuaryÂ 

Â 

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Â |

-
|Scenario|Graphically display actual sales totals for past and current months (updated to date) for a given period (two past and current).|
|Given|A department director|
|When|open the month detail screen|
|Then|Shows graphically as a black line the sales volume in euro for a completed month or current month to date.Â 
Â 
Note: In the case of a current month, sales up to the current day (last update) will be shown (if we are on December 7, sales of A up to December 7 will be shown).|
|And|And the tooltip will show the volume in â‚¬.Â |

-
|Scenario|Display graphically of complete monthly sales for an equivalent period (default fiscal year)|
|Given|A department director|
|When|Opens SITDEP IOS|
|Then|It shows graphically with a thin black line the sales volume of an equivalent period (A-1) in euros for one month, showing the final picture of each month of an equivalent fiscal year.Â 
Note: In the case of a current month, the *TOTAL* sales made in the equivalent year during that month will be shown (if we are on December 7, the sales of A-1 up to December 31 will be shown).|
|AndÂ |And the tooltip will show the volume in â‚¬.
In this case the tooltip will show the sales of the year equivalent to the equivalent period, i.e. if we are on day 7 to day 7Â |

-
|Scenario|Show the variation of sales with respect to an equivalent periodÂ |
|Given|A department director|
|When|Opens SITDEP IOS|
|Then|It shows the variation of sales of a specific month with respect to its equivalent period. Showing whether sales have increased or decreased in a given month.Â 
Note: In the case of a current month, it will show the variation of sales until the last day that we have data, that is to say, if we are on December 7, it will show the variation until December 7 with respect to the equivalent year.Â |
|AndÂ |And in IOS this data will be displayed in the tooltipÂ |

-
|Scenario|Show the variation of sales of an equivalent period with respect to its equivalent period.|
|Given|A department director|
|When|Opens SITDEP IOS|
|Then|Shows the variation of sales for a given month of an equivalent period with respect to its equivalent period. Showing whether sales have increased or decreased in a given month.Â 
Note: In the case of a current month, it will show the variation of sales up to the last day we have data, that is, if we are on December 7, it will show the variation up to December 7 of the equivalent year with respect to its equivalent.|
|AndÂ |And in IOS this data will be displayed in the tooltipÂ |

-
|Scenario|Display data by amount or unitsÂ |
|Given|A user that opens SITDEP|
|When|Select in the graph to view the data by amount or units.|
|Then|All the data of the sales chart will be shown in amount or units depending on the user's selection.Â |

-
|Scenario|Error|
|Given|A user that opens SITDEP|
|When|There is an error to be displayed|
|Then|Sees the data as an error icon specified by UX|

|Scenario|Data format|

|Then|Sees the data in the following format:

 - Highlight negative values (red)Â *UX*
 - 0% may exist and can be red if the variation is negative before rounding (-0,1%)|

|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as follows (A-1 / A / Result):

|When|Sees the variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as: Variation = (CurrentValue - LastValue) / LastValue (in percentage)|

|When|Sees the volume in unitsÂ |

*AS*Â a sitdep userÂ 

*I WANT* to be able to view the departmental product hierarchy, its planning hierarchy, sorted by sales weight for the selected month and to be able to display this hierarchy in the elements inside it.

*TO* be able to analyse the sales volume of each element of the hierarchyÂ 

Â 

{*}DESCRIPTION{*}:Â 

The idea of this story is to be able to see what the list of products sold by a department in the selected month consists of, sorted by the planning hierarchy of the department (in the future it will be possible to sort by other types of hierarchies, such as by items).Â 
This list will be sorted by sales weight (what each item in the list represents in relation to the total sales for the month). In addition, the total sales volume of each item in the list and the variation in sales of each item with respect to A-1 will be shown.Â 

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Â |

-
|Scenario|The user sees the list of items that make up each item in the hierarchy sorted by sales weight|
|Given|the user is in the month detail screenÂ *WEB*|
|When|the user chooses to view the list of items sorted by sales weight and selects to display an item in the hierarchy|
|Then|the user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight and will be able to navigate through the different items, navigating from the top levels of the hierarchy to the lowest.Â |

-

|Given|the user is on the month detail screen inÂ *IOS*|
|When|the user chooses to view the list of items sorted by sales weight and selects to display an item in the hierarchy|
|Then|the user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight.
The user then sees at first glance the 3 items in the list of items sorted by sales weight, seeing then, the 3 items with the highest weight in the listÂ |
|AND|he can then navigate to another screen to see the complete list sorted by weight, navigating from the top levels of the hierarchy to the lower levels, i.e. he can select an item to see the contents of each item in the hierarchy.Â |
|AND|the user can return to the month detail screen by clicking on the back arrow.|

*AS* a sitdep userÂ 

*I WANT* to be able to view the departmental product hierarchy, its planning hierarchy, sorted by sales weight for the selected month.

*TO* be able to analyse the sales volume of each element of the hierarchy.

Â 

{*}DESCRIPTION{*}:Â 

The idea of this story is to be able to see the list of products sold by a department in the selected month sorted by the department's planning hierarchy (in the future it will be possible to sort by other types of hierarchies, such as item).Â 
This list will be sorted by sales weight (what each item in the list represents in relation to the total sales for the month). In addition, the total sales volume of each item in the list and the variation in sales of each item with respect to A-1 will be shown.Â 

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Â |

-
|Scenario|The user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight.|
|Given|the user is in the month detail screen *WEB*|
|When|the user chooses to view the list of items sorted by sales weight|
|Then|the user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight and will be able to navigate through the different items, navigating from the top levels of the hierarchy to the lowest.Â |

-
|Scenario|The user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight.|
|Given|the user is on the month detail screen in *IOS*|
|When|the user chooses to view the list of items sorted by sales weight|
|Then|the user sees the list of items sorted by sales weight.
The user then sees at first glance the 3 items in the list of items sorted by sales weight, seeing then, the 3 items with the highest weight in the list.Â |
|AND|he can then navigate to another screen to see the complete list sorted by weight, navigating from the top levels of the hierarchy down to the bottom levels.|
|AND|the user can return to the month detail screen by clicking on the back arrow.|

-
|Scenario|User views weight percentage of each item|
|Given|the user is viewing the list of items sorted by sales weight|
|When|the user looks at the list|
|Then|The user sees the percentage weight (numerically and graphically) of each item, i.e. he sees the sales weight of each item in the list in percentage and graphically where the bar graph represents that weight, with 100% being the total sales for the month.|

-
|Scenario|The user views the sales volume of each item in Euro.|
|Given|the user is viewing the list of items sorted by sales weight|
|When|the user looks at the list|
|Then|the user sees the sales volume of each item in Euro.|

-
|Scenario|Â The user views the sales variation of each item against A-1.|
|Given|the user is looking at the list of items sorted by sales weight|
|When|the user looks at the list|
|Then|the user sees the sales variance of each item against A-1|

-

-
|Scenario|Data format|
|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the weight of sales|
|Then|Sees the data in the following format:Â 
 - Rounded value to close whole number (9,83 ->10; 9,3 -> 9; 42,8 -> 43)|

-
|Scenario|Calculation logic|
|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the percentage of sales of an article it represents of the totalÂ |
|Then|Sees the data calculated as: Volume= (expected Sales of a product/Total expected volume)*100|

Â 

-

|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the sales variation|
|Then|Sees the data in the following format:

 - +/- always before variation to indicate positive/negatives
 - Highlight negative values (red) *UX*
 - 0% may exist and can be red if the variation is negative before rounding (-0,1%)|

-

|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the sales variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as follows (A-1 / A / Result):
 - Positive / Positive / Calculation
 - Negative or 0 / Positive / +100%
 - Positive or 0 / Negative / -100%
 - Negative or 0 / Negative or 0 / "-"|

|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the purchases variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as: Variation = [(CurrentValue(A) - LastValue(A-1)) / LastValue(A-1)]* 100 (in percentage)|

-

|Given|A user that opens SITDEP|
|When|There is no data to be displayed|
|Then|Sees data variation as "-"|

content:
*AS* a sitdep user

*I WANT* to understand the average price of the articles I purchase

*TO* understand if I follow my department strategy

{*}DESCRIPTION{*}:

Articles can have more than one price:
 * The price it costs
 * The price you expect it to be sold (sell price)
 * The price you finally sell it (the previous one + some corrections if you made a promotion) -> This is the price we use to calculate mkup
 * ...

In this story we want to identify the average sell price of the items you purchased up to date (the 2nd option of the list)

Departments can have a strategy of increasing/decreasing the average price in some items or in general. This indicators helps them to understand how tings are going compared to equivalent period

This is displayed in reports like this:

!image-2023-09-25-18-31-58-674.png|width=279,height=120!

And we want it to be displayed as a KPI

!image-2023-10-16-15-42-17-275.png|width=420,height=345!

{*}WEB{*}: [https://www.figma.com/file/GG3t96nPKWEqTtC6uHeyqO/Direcci%C3%B3n-y-planificaci%C3%B3n-%2F-Situaci%C3%B3n-departamento-Desktop?type=design&node-id=7743-8733&mode=design&t=YOtbYzhNvMjjRzc6-0]Â 

Â 

!image-2023-10-17-08-45-23-044.png|width=390,height=437!

IOS: [https://www.figma.com/file/n4sZ9nivIUIYeEZjDiLwUV/Direcci%C3%B3n-y-planificaci%C3%B3n-%2F-Situaci%C3%B3n-departamento-IOS?type=design&node-id=5028-1311&mode=design&t=cG2pcbTjDlHzlQC0-0]Â 

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Â |

-
|Scenario|Display average price KPI|
|Given|A sitdep user|
|When|Goes to the purchase detail section|
|Then|Can see the average sales price KPI for the filter he has applied (campaigns, department hierarchy...)|

-
|Scenario|Average price KPI|
|Given|A sitdep user|
|When|Looks at the average price KPI|
|Then|He sees the average sales price of sale in euros for all the purchased items in the selected campaign up to yesterday in â‚¬|
|And|He sees the average sales price of sale in euros for all the purchased items in the selected campaign up to the equivalent day to yesterday in â‚¬|
|And|He sees the variation between these two values in %|

-
|Scenario|Apply filters|
|Given|A sitdep users|
|When|Applies any filter in the purchase section (department, campaign...)|
|Then|Sees the average sales price KPI vary according to the applied filter|

-
|Scenario|Data format|
|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the variation|
|Then|Sees the data in the following format:
 - Rounded value to close decimal (9,83 ->9,8 ; 9,5 -> 9,5; 9,48 -> 9,5)
 - +/- always before variation to indicate positive/negatives
 - Highlight negative values (red)Â *UX*
 - 0% may exist and can be red if the variation is negative before rounding (-0,1%)|

-
|Scenario|Data calculation|
|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as follows (A-1 / A / Result):
 - Positive / Positive / Calculation
 - Negative or 0 / Positive / +100%
 - Positive or 0 / Negative / -100%
 - Negative or 0 / Negative or 0 / "-"|

-
|Scenario|Calculation logic|
|Given|A user|
|When|Sees the variation|
|Then|Sees the data calculated as: Variation = (CurrentValue - LastValue) / LastValue (in percentage)|

-
|Scenario|No data|
|Given|A user that opens SITDEP|
|When|There is no data to be displayed|
|Then|Sees data variation as "-"|

*AS* a sitdep user

*I WANT* to see the total purchased for my commercial level and its hierarcy

*TO* understand how my department/section is performing and if I have deviations in the next hierarchical level

{*}DESCRIPTION{*}:

Sitdep users belong to a given commercial level (we are assuming, in general) that they belong to a department but they could also belong to a section

In this story we want them to:
 * See how purchase is going for my level vs Y-1
 * See how purchase is going for the next level vs Y-1
 * Use that hiearchy as a filter por the rest of the information

We understand purchase as the total purchased for the selected campaign and hierarchical level

*AS* department managerÂ 

*I WANT* to see graphically by week the evolution of actual sales and the evolution of sales in an equivalent period (A-1).Â

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:*Â 
|Feature|Â |

-
|Scenario|Display graphically the actual sales of both past and current weeks of a given month|

|Scenario|Display graphically of weekly sales for an equivalent month|

 - Rounded value to close decimal(9,83 ->9,8 ; 9,5 -> 9,5; 9,48 -> 9,5)
